Download File

he following people are the descendants of President John Adams. Most information has come from "Henry Adams of Braintree and Some of His Descendants." The following pages list data for all known family members as of July 30, 2017. I've added information for the last few generations through research in the US Census, Passenger Lists, etc. I take responsibility for any errors. Feel free to email me with any corrections or additions. I value your input.

Also, if anyone is interested, I created a book with all this information in a .pdf format which can be downloaded - see above. Email me direct with any other request you may have. There is no cost involved.

Best regards,

Myra Adams Chiles

West Chester PA

8/25/2017

adamsgen@comcast.net

Family of John Adams and Abigail Smith

1. Pres. John Adams was born on October 19, 1735, in Braintree, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA.[[1]] He was the son of John Adams and Susanna Boylston. John died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 4, 1826, at the age of 90. He was buried in First Unitarian Church Cemetery, Hancock, Berkshire Co., MA, in July 1826. At the age of 28, John married Abigail Smith on Friday, February 24, 1764, in Weymouth, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, when she was 19 years old.[[2]] They had five children. Abigail Smith was born in Weymouth, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on November 23, 1744. Abigail reached 73 years of age and died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on October 28, 1818. She was the daughter of William Smith and Elizabeth Quincy.

Children of John Adams and Abigail Smith:

+ 2 I. Abigail Adams was born in Braintree, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 14, 1765. She died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on August 15, 1813, at the age of 48.[[3]]

+ 3 II. John Quincy Adams was born in Braintree, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 11, 1767. He died in Washington, DC, on February 23, 1848, at the age of 80.

III. Susanna Adams was born in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on December 28, 1768. She died in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on February 4, 1770, at the age of 1.

+ 4 IV. Charles Adams was born in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on May 29, 1770. He died in New York, USA, on November 30, 1800, at the age of 30.

+ 5 V. Thomas Boylston Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on September 15, 1772. He died on March 12, 1832, at the age of 59.

Families of his Descendants

1st Generation

Family of Abigail Adams and William Smith

2. Abigail Adams was born on Sunday, July 14, 1765, in Braintree, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA. She was the daughter of John Adams (1) and Abigail Smith. Abigail died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on August 15, 1813, at the age of 48.[[4]] Abigail married William Stephens Smith in 1786 in Massachusetts, USA.[[5]] They had three children. William Stephens Smith was born on Saturday, November 8, 1755. William Stephens served in the military. Colonel. He reached 60 years of age and died on June 10, 1816. William Stephens was buried in Sherburne West Hill Cemetery, Sherburne, Chenango, New York, USA.

Children of Abigail Adams and William Stephens Smith:

+ 6 I. William Steuben Smith was born in London, England, on April 2, 1787. He died in Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, in 1853 at the age of 65.

II. Caroline Amelia Smith.

III. John Adams Smith.

Family of John Adams and Louisa Johnson

3. Pres. John Quincy Adams was born on Saturday, July 11, 1767, in Braintree, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA. He was the son of John Adams (1) and Abigail Smith. John Quincy died in Washington, DC, on February 23, 1848, at the age of 80. At the age of 30, John Quincy married Louisa Catherine Johnson on Wednesday, July 26, 1797, in Braintree, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, when she was 22 years old. They had four children. Louisa Catherine Johnson was born in London, England, on Wednesday, February 22, 1775. Louisa Catherine reached 76 years of age and died in 1852.

Children of John Quincy Adams and Louisa Catherine Johnson:

I. George Washington Adams was born in Berlin, Germany, on April 13, 1801. He died in Long Island Sound on April 30, 1829, at the age of 28. His cause of death was Drowned.

+ 7 II. John Adams was born in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 4, 1803. He died in Washington, DC, on October 23, 1834, at the age of 31.

+ 8 III. Charles Francis Adams was born in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on August 18, 1807. He died in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on November 21, 1886, at the age of 79.

IV. Louisa Catherine Adams was born in St. Petersburg, Russia, in 1811.

Family of Charles Adams and Sarah Smith

4. Charles Adams was born on Tuesday, May 29, 1770, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA. He was the son of John Adams (1) and Abigail Smith. Charles died in New York, USA, on November 30, 1800, at the age of 30. At the age of 25, Charles married Sarah Smith on Saturday, August 29, 1795, when she was 25 years old. They had two daughters. Sarah Smith was born on Monday, November 6, 1769. Sarah reached 58 years of age and died on August 3, 1828.

Daughters of Charles Adams and Sarah Smith:

+ 9 I. Susanna B. Adams was born in New York, USA, on August 8, 1796. She died on January 21, 1846, at the age of 49.

+ 10 II. Abigail Louisa Adams was born in New York, USA, between September 8, 1796 and 1798. She died on July 4, 1838.

Family of Thomas Adams and Ann Harrod

5. Hon. Thomas Boylston Adams was born on Tuesday, September 15, 1772, in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA. He was the son of John Adams (1) and Abigail Smith. Thomas Boylston died on March 12, 1832, at the age of 59. Thomas Boylston married Ann Harrod on Thursday, May 16, 1805. They had seven children. Ann Harrod was born about 1776. Ann reached 70 years of age and died on September 3, 1846.

Children of Thomas Boylston Adams and Ann Harrod:

+ 11 I. Abigail Smith Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 29, 1806.[[6]] She died in Cambridge, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on February 4, 1845, at the age of 38.[[7]]

II. Elizabeth Combs Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on February 9, 1808.[6] She died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, in 1903 at the age of 94.[[8]]

III. Thomas Boylston Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on April 4, 1809.[6] He died in Fort Dade, Pinellas, Florida, USA, on December 14, 1837, at the age of 28.

IV. Frances Foster Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on June 22, 1811.[6] She died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on March 4, 1812.

V. Isaac Hull Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on May 26, 1813.[6] He died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on November 5, 1900, at the age of 87.[[9]]

VI. John Quincy Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on December 16, 1815.[6] He died in At sea in October 1854 at the age of 38.

VII. Joseph Harrod Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on December 16, 1817.[6] He died on October 4, 1853, at the age of 35.

2nd Generation

Family of William Smith and Catherine Johnson

6. William Steuben Smith was born on Monday, April 2, 1787, in London, England. He was the son of William Stephens Smith and Abigail Adams (2). William Steuben died in Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, in 1853 at the age of 65. He married Catherine Johnson. They had one daughter. Catherine Johnson was born in Haverhill, Essex, Massachusetts, USA, in 1788. Catherine reached 81 years of age and died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, in 1869.

Daughter of William Steuben Smith and Catherine Johnson:

+ 12 I. Caroline Amerial Smith was born on January 27, 1795. She died on July 28, 1852, at the age of 57.

Family of John Adams and Mary Hellen7. John Adams was born on Monday, July 4, 1803, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA. He was the son of John Quincy Adams (3) and Louisa Catherine Johnson. John died in Washington, DC, on October 23, 1834, at the age of 31. John married Mary Catherine Hellen in 1826 in Whtie House, Washington, DC. They had two daughters.

Daughters of John Adams and Mary Catherine Hellen:

+ 13 I. Mary Louisa Adams was born in Washington, DC, on December 2, 1828. She died in Far Rockaway, Queens Co., NY, on July 16, 1859, at the age of 30.

II. Frances Adams was born in Washington, DC, in 1830. She died in Washington, DC, on October 2, 1839, at the age of 9.

Family of Charles Adams and Abigail Brooks

8. Hon. Charles Francis Adams was born on Tuesday, August 18, 1807, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA. He was the son of John Quincy Adams (3) and Louisa Catherine Johnson. Charles Francis died in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on November 21, 1886, at the age of 79. At the age of 22, Charles Francis married Abigail Brown Brooks on Thursday, September 3, 1829, in Medford, Norfolk Co., MA, when she was 21 years old.[[10]] They had seven children. Abigail Brown Brooks was born in Medford, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on Monday, April 25, 1808. Abigail Brown reached 81 years of age and died on June 6, 1889.

V. Arthur Adams was born in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 23, 1841. He died in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on February 9, 1846, at the age of 4.

+ 18 VI. Mary Adams was born in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, on February 19, 1846.

+ 19 VII. Brooks Adams was born in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on June 24, 1848. He died after 1920.

Susanna Adams

9. Susanna B. Adams was born on Monday, August 8, 1796, in New York, USA. She was the daughter of Charles Adams (4) and Sarah Smith. Susanna B. died on January 21, 1846, at the age of 49. Marriages with Lieut. Charles Thomas Clark and William R. H. Treadway .

Family of Susanna Adams and Charles Clark

Here are the details about Susanna B. Adams first marriage with Lieut. Charles Thomas Clark. Susanna B. Adams married Lieut. Charles Thomas Clark on Sunday, August 3, 1817. They had one daughter. Lieut. Charles Thomas Clark was born in 1793. Charles Thomas reached 25 years of age and died in 1818.

Family of Abigail Adams and Alexander Johnson

Abigail Louisa married Alexander Bryan Johnson on Friday, October 14, 1814. They had nine children. Alexander Bryan Johnson was born in Gosport, England, on Monday, May 29, 1786. Alexander Bryan reached 81 years of age and died on September 9, 1867.

Family of Abigail Adams and John Angier

11. Abigail Smith Adams was born on Tuesday, July 29, 1806, in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA.[[11]] She was the daughter of Thomas Boylston Adams (5) and Ann Harrod. Abigail Smith died in Cambridge, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on February 4, 1845, at the age of 38.[[12]] Her cause of death was Consumption. Abigail Smith married John Angier on Monday, May 30, 1831, in Medford, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA.[[13]] John died in Texas in June 1863.

3rd Generation

Family of Caroline Smith and William De Windt

12. Caroline Amerial Smith was born on Tuesday, January 27, 1795. She was the daughter of William Steuben Smith (6) and Catherine Johnson. Caroline Amerial died on July 28, 1852, at the age of 57. She married William Peter De Windt.

Family of Mary Adams and William Johnson

Mary Louisa died in Far Rockaway, Queens Co., NY, on July 16, 1859, at the age of 30. She married William Clarkson Johnson. They had three children. William Clarkson Johnson was born in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA, on Saturday, August 16, 1823. William Clarkson reached 69 years of age and died in New York, New York, USA, on January 28, 1893. He was the son of Alexander Bryan Johnson and Abigail Louisa Adams (10).

Louisa Catherine married Charles Kuhn on Thursday, April 13, 1854, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA.[[16]] Charles Kuhn was born in Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, about 1822. Charles died after 1897.

Family of John Adams and Fanny Crowningshield

John Quincy died in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on July 16, 1894, at the age of 60. John Quincy married Fanny Cadwallader Crowningshield on Monday, April 29, 1861. They had six children. Fanny Cadwallader Crowningshield was born in Massachusetts, USA, about 1840. Fanny Cadwallader died after 1910.

Family of Charles Adams and Mary Ogden

Charles Francis died in Washington, District of Columbia, USA, between 1910 and 1920. At the age of 30, Charles Francis married Mary Ogden on Wednesday, November 8, 1865, when she was 22 years old. They had five children. Mary Ogden was born in New York, USA, on Thursday, February 23, 1843. Mary died after 1920.

Family of Henry Adams and Miriam Hooper

Henry died in Washington DC on March 27, 1918, at the age of 80. At the age of 34, Henry married Miriam Hooper on Thursday, June 27, 1872, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA, when she was 29 years old. Miriam Hooper was born on Tuesday, September 13, 1842. Miriam reached 43 years of age and died on December 6, 1885.

Family of Mary Adams and Henry Quincy

18. Mary Adams was born on Thursday, February 19, 1846, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA. She was the daughter of Charles Francis Adams (8) and Abigail Brown Brooks. Mary married Dr. Henry P. Quincy on Wednesday, June 20, 1877. They had two daughters.

II. Eleanor Quincy was born in Dedham, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, on March 11, 1888.

Brooks married Evelyn Davis on Saturday, September 7, 1889, in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA. Evelyn Davis was born in Massachusetts, USA, in January 1853. Evelyn died after 1920.

Susan Maria died in Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA, on August 27, 1853, at the age of 14. Susan Maria married A. Judson Crane on Monday, March 2, 1818, in Philadelphia, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, USA.

Family of Alexander Johnson and Catherine Cryssler

21. Alexander Smith Johnson was born on Wednesday, July 30, 1817, in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA. He was the son of Alexander Bryan Johnson and Abigail Louisa Adams (10). Alexander Smith died in Nassau, Rensselaer Co., NY, on January 26, 1878, at the age of 60. He married Catherine Cryssler. They had four children. Catherine Cryssler was born in Canada about 1834.

I. Catherine M. Johnson was born in Albany, Albany, New York, USA, about 1854.

II. Abigail A. Johnson was born in Albany, Albany, New York, USA, about 1856.

IV. Alice J. Johnson was born in New York, USA, about 1867.

William Johnson

22. William Clarkson Johnson was born on Saturday, August 16, 1823, in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA. He was the son of Alexander Bryan Johnson and Abigail Louisa Adams (10). William Clarkson died in New York, New York, USA, on January 28, 1893, at the age of 69. Marriages with Henrietta Maria Douw, Mary Louisa Adams (Page 16) and Mary Cornelia Nicholson are known.

Family of William Johnson and Henrietta Douw

William Clarkson Johnson married Henrietta Maria Douw.

Family of William Johnson and Mary Adams

William Clarkson Johnson married Mary Louisa Adams. They had three children. Mary Louisa Adams was born in Washington, DC, on Tuesday, December 2, 1828. Mary Louisa reached 30 years of age and died in Far Rockaway, Queens Co., NY, on July 16, 1859.

This family is duplicated because of common ancestors. For further details see person reference number 13 on page 13.

Family of William Johnson and Mary Nicholson

Here are the details about William Clarkson Johnson's third marriage with Mary Cornelia Nicholson. You can read more about William Clarkson on page 16.

William Clarkson Johnson married Mary Cornelia Nicholson.

Sarah Adams married James Stoughton Lynch on Friday, April 28, 1848. James Stoughton died in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA, on April 3, 1890.

Family of Louisa Johnson and George Alley

â25. Louisa Ann Smith Johnson was born on Saturday, November 24, 1832, in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA. She was the daughter of Alexander Bryan Johnson and Abigail Louisa Adams (10). Louisa Ann Smith married George Bolton Alley on Monday, April 19, 1852.

Family of Frances Johnson and Charles Williams

26. Frances Elizabeth Johnson was born on Saturday, November 7, 1835, in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA. She was the daughter of Alexander Bryan Johnson and Abigail Louisa Adams (10). She married Charles Platt Williams.

4th Generation

Family of Mary Johnson and Charles Doolittle

27. Mary Adams Johnson was born on Saturday, April 1, 1854, in Washington, DC. She was the daughter of William Clarkson Johnson (22) and Mary Louisa Adams (13). Mary Adams died in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA, on December 26, 1920, at the age of 66.[[17]] At the age of 21, Mary Adams married Charles Andrews Doolittle on Thursday, September 2, 1875, when he was 25 years old. They had five children. Charles Andrews Doolittle was born in New York, USA, on Saturday, September 22, 1849. Charles Andrews reached 71 years of age and died in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA, on January 26, 1921.

Children of Mary Adams Johnson and Charles Andrews Doolittle:

+ 34 II. William Clark Johnson Doolittle was born in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA, on April 16, 1879. He died in Oneida Co., NY, in August 1967 at the age of 88.[[19]]

III. Charles Andrew Doolittle was born in New York, USA, in December 1881.

IV. John Quincy Adams Doolittle was born in New York, USA, in February 1884. He died before 1910.

+ 35 V. Ebenezer Shearman Doolittle was born in Utica, Oneida, New York, USA, on September 24, 1889. He was also known as Eben. Ebenezer Shearman died in Washington, District of Columbia, USA, on April 8, 1944, at the age of 54.

Family of Louisa Johnson and Erskine Clement

28. Louisa Catherine Johnson was born on Saturday, March 29, 1856, in Washington, DC. She was the daughter of William Clarkson Johnson (22) and Mary Louisa Adams (13). Louisa Catherine died about 1948 at the age of 91. At the age of 25, Louisa Catherine married Erskine Clement on Tuesday, December 20, 1881, in Newbury, Essex, Massachusetts, USA, when he was 24 years old.[[20]] They had two children. Erskine Clement was born in Milford, Worcester, Massachusetts, USA, on Thursday, October 15, 1857.[[21], [22]] Erskine died after 1920.

+ 36 II. Clarence Erskine Clement was born in Newbury, Essex, Massachusetts, USA, on July 20, 1884.

Family of John Johnson and Caroline Curtis

29. John Quincy Adams Johnson was born on Saturday, February 12, 1859, in Washington, District of Columbia, USA. He was the son of William Clarkson Johnson (22) and Mary Louisa Adams (13). John Quincy Adams died in Yonkers, Westchester, New York, USA, on April 9, 1938, at the age of 79.[[23]] John Quincy Adams married Caroline Curtis about 1884. They had eight children. Caroline Curtis was born in New York, USA, on Saturday, September 13, 1862. Caroline reached 70 years of age and died in Yonkers, Westchester, New York, USA, on October 2, 1932.

Family of Mary Adams and Grafton Abbott

30. Mary Adams was born on Saturday, July 27, 1867, in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA. She was the daughter of Charles Francis Adams (16) and Mary Ogden. Mary died after 1920. At the age of 23, Mary married Grafton St. Leon Abbott on Tuesday, September 30, 1890, when he was 33 years old. They had three children. Grafton St. Leon Abbott was born in Lowell, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on Friday, November 14, 1856. Grafton St. Leon reached 58 years of age and died in Concord, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on February 27, 1915. He was buried in Sleepy Hollow Cemetery, Concord, Middlesex Massachusetts, USA.

Children of Mary Adams and Grafton St. Leon Abbott:

I. Henry Livermore Abbott was born in Lewiston, Androscoggin, Maine, USA, on April 12, 1892. He died in Washington, District of Columbia, USA, on April 15, 1969, at the age of 77.[[24]]

II. Mary Ogden Abbott was born in Concord, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on October 12, 1894. She died in Concord, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on May 11, 1981, at the age of 86.

III. John Adams Abbott was born in Concord, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on July 7, 1902. He died in Newton, Middlesex, Massachusetts, USA, on January 6, 1995, at the age of 92.[[25]]

Family of Louisa Adams and Thomas Perkins

31. Louisa J. Catherine Adams was born on Thursday, December 28, 1871, in Quincy, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA. She was the daughter of Charles Francis Adams (16) and Mary Ogden. Louisa J. Catherine died after 1930. Louisa J. Catherine married Thomas Nelson Perkins on Wednesday, June 6, 1900, in Boston, Suffolk, Massachusetts, USA.[[26]] They had three sons. Thomas Nelson Perkins was born in Milton, Norfolk, Massachusetts, USA, about 1870.

II. James Handasyd Perkins was born in Westwood, Norfolk Co., MA, on November 17, 1903.[[29]] He died in Westwood, Norfolk Co., MA, on June 10, 1985, at the age of 81.[28]

III. Thomas Nelson Perkins was born in Westwood, Norfolk Co., MA, on April 30, 1907.[[30]] He died in May 1965 at the age of 58.[[31]]

Family of Alexander Johnson and Louise White
